oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dual Infection of the Bovine Fetus with Bovine Virus Diarrhea Type 1 and Type 2: Can it Happen and What are the Implications for Vaccination?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chase, C. C. L.
Braun, L. J.
Brock, K. V.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine virus diarrhea virus
persistently infected
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Infection of the fetus between 40-120 days of gestation with bovine virus diarrhea virus (BVDV) results in a persistently infected animal that is a constant source of BVDV to the herd.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1999; 245
